result.execSummary:
The defendant Nina M Magestro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with Standard Release Conditions. Sentence credit of 11 days was granted, if imposed.

miscConds.notes: AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s. No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

No contact with the Home Depot store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS, commencing forthwith.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nina M Magestro

defendant.name: Magestro, Nina M
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Hughes advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Capias issued as Defendant is a Huber walk-a-way.  Upon defendant being detained she is to serve the balance of her condition time as Straight Time; Huber has been revoked per Judge Paul F. Reilly for Branch 7.

Jail Administration request for capias due to Huber walk-a-way.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/15/22 - Court will issue a capias, upon defendant's return the balance of her condition time is to be served Straight Time.**

10:20 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Nina M Magestro in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Nina M Magestro. Court notes a plea questionnaire as well as a motion to modify bail has been filed and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Hughes is asking the court to proceed with plea and sentencing and is withdrawing his motion to modify bail.  Court will accept the withdrawal of the motion to modify bail by defense.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office and State is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Hughes confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 with the repeater enhancer struck, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in.


Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Hughes.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1: 
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

12 Months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS (11 Days Credit IF imposed).

Term of Probation: 24 Months

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with the Home Depot store listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.

Condition Time: 45 Days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.

COSTS:  $278.00 (includes DRGOD surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Bail/bond hearing on August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:23 AM Defendant Nina M Magestro in court, in custody.  SPD Intern, Patrick Sicula for Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Nina M Magestro.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
